REST API main¶

class main.UserModel(*, username: str, password: str)¶

Bases: BaseModel

model_computed_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}¶

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'password': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True), 'username': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True)}¶

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(db: Session, contact: ContactCreate, user: User) → Contact¶

Creates a new note for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

SQLAlchemyContact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(db: Session, user: User, contact_id: int) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

SQLAlchemyContact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(db: Session, user: User, contact_id: int) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contact for.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

SQLAlchemyContact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session, user: User, search_query: str = None) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of notes for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • search_query (str) – Search for contacts by query.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[SQLAlchemyContact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_upcoming_birthdays(db: Session) → Contact | None¶

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays

Parameters:

db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

list of contacts who have birthdays this week, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

SQLAlchemyContact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(db: Session, user: User, contact_id: int, contact: ContactCreate) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to update contact for.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The updated data for the contact.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

SQLAlchemyContact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Email address verification.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – User email.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Setting the value of the confirmed attribute in the database to True for the selected user.

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Create user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Adds a new user to the database.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Get user by email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – User email.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Takes an email and database session and returns a user object from the database if a user with that email address exists.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates a token for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update the token for.

  • token (str) – The updated data for the token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Updates the user’s refresh_token field and applies changes to the database.

Return type:

None
